metadata.Title: CVE-2009-3720 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
The updatePosition function in lib/xmltok_impl.c in libexpat in Expat2.0.1, as used in Python, PyXML, w3c-libwww, and other software, allowscontext-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (applicationcrash) via an XML document with crafted UTF-8 sequences that trigger abuffer over-read, a different vulnerability than CVE-2009-2625.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2009-3720` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.0.1-7ubuntu1
lib64expat1 - 2.0.1-7ubuntu1
libexpat1 - 2.0.1-7ubuntu1
No subscription required

libxmlrpc-c++4 - 1.06.27-1ubuntu7
libxmlrpc-core-c3 - 1.06.27-1ubuntu7
xmlrpc-api-utils - 1.06.27-1ubuntu7
No subscription required

paraview - 3.8.1-1ubuntu1
paraview-python - 3.8.1-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

ayttm - 0.6.1-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: expat package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.1-7ubuntu1').
xmlrpc-c package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.06.27-1ubuntu7').
paraview package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.8.1-1ubuntu1').
